programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: As Brockmire deals with his newfound sobriety, he is introduced as the new announcer for the Oakland Athletics with his co-announcer and former softball star Gabby Taylor.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Brockmire struggles to accept that Jules' new boyfriend is his good friend.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: While dealing with a case of broadcaster's anxiety that makes it hard to remember the count, Brockmire faces threats from his predecessor, Matt "The Bat" Hardesty; Brockmire prays to God for the first time.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Brockmire's mother, who abandoned him and his sister at a young age, comes to town and challenges his relationship with his sister.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Brockmire urges Charles to leave a toxic relationship; Charles is appalled by Gus' producing skills; Brockmire becomes infatuated with Matt Hardesty's nurse.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Brockmire goes out of his way to be a good friend when Gabby discovers she is pregnant and finds her wife cheating on her.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Brockmire deals with sobriety-induced impotence and Matt's declining health; his AA sponsor reminds Brockmire that he needs to find a higher power if he wants his anxiety gone.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Brockmire and Gabby finally get a chance to call their first regular season MLB game for Oakland, but are confronted by protestors who are disciples of bigot Art Newlie.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: In the year 2030, the world is in chaos but at least Jim broadcasts his favorite sport and has the love of his daughter; Jim then learns baseball is worse off than he thinks and his daughter is moving to New York for college.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Jim is trying hard to enact change in the league but the owners don't seem to care or want it; at the same time, Jim's relationship with his daughter is becoming worse, with visits becoming less frequent as she pulls away and becomes an adult.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Baseball is barely holding on so Jim turns to the one person he knows can turn it around, Jules James; however, it's going to take a lot of convincing to get her to leave Morristown to help a sport and man who both turned their backs on her.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Jim and Jules agree to keep their relationship professional, but when they team up to trick the owners into selling the teams to new owners who will let them make the changes they want, their antics remind them of the relationship they used to have.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Jules tries to win Beth's approval of the relationship she and Brockmire are trying to rekindle, but they don't get along until Jules takes Beth under her wing as a drinking buddy; Jim is irate that Jules was a bad influence on his daughter.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: As Beth was growing up, Jim told her everything he knew about her deceased birth mother, but she finds out that he lied to her; on the biggest day of Jim's life, Beth is supposed to give a speech to memorialize him.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Baseball players' union contracts are up for re-negotiation and a potential strike threatens the future of baseball altogether; Jim and Jules give it one last go and try to negotiate the terms of their potential relationship.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Artificial intelligence threatens to take steps in its pursuit to rule the world and attempts to take over baseball. Jim and Jules must decide if they want to embolden this emerging society ruled by machines or stay with the failing status quo.

programme.desc: A comic looks for inspiration for his next movie among the absurdly competitive parents and coaches involved with his son's youth-baseball league.

programme.desc: Rare and interesting Star Wars items making their way into the Stash; Walt offers up big cash to try and score a beacon for the store.

programme.desc: Kevin Smith and the guys attend the premiere screening of a movie about themselves and the origination of the film "Clerks."

programme.title: Comic Book Men
programme.desc: Actor Burt Ward, best known for portraying television's famous Robin the Boy Wonder, reminisces about his time on the set of "Batman" and judges the Stash's canine cosplay contest.

programme.title: Comic Book Men
programme.desc: Walt meets his match during a heated negotiation with actor Mike Colter ("Luke Cage"); a "legendary" video game becomes both Walt's trash and Ming's treasure.

programme.desc: Troma Entertainment co-founder Lloyd Kaufman and his crew put the guys through a grueling audition to see if they have what it takes to be in a Troma film.
